# Load Libraries
```{python}
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np

games = pd.read_csv('Video_Games_Sales_as_at_22_Dec_2016.csv')
```

# Data Wrangling

```{python}
# Drop columns 'User_Score', 'Critic_Score', 'User_Count'
games = games.drop(['User_Score', 'Critic_Count', 'User_Count', 'NA_Sales', 'EU_Sales', 'JP_Sales', 'Other_Sales'], axis=1)

# Check for missing values
missing_values = games.isna().sum()

# Print the count of missing values for each column
print(missing_values) 

# Print the cleaned DataFrame
games.head(10)

# Drop rows with "NaN" values
games = games.dropna()

# Check for missing values
missing_values = games.isna().sum()

# Print the count of missing values for each column
print(missing_values) 

# Print the cleaned DataFrame
games.head(10)


# Write the filtered DataFrame to a new CSV file
games.to_csv('Cleaned_MachineLearning_Dataset.csv', index=False)


```
